item.title: Three Companies Impersonated Millions to Influence Internet Policy
item.description: - New York Attorney General secured $615,000 from LCX, Lead ID, and Ifficient for supplying millions of fake public comments in 2017 to influence Federal Communications Commission's (FCC) decision to repeal net neutrality rules.

item.title: Run Llama 13B with a 6GB graphics card
item.description: - It is possible to run Llama 13B with a 6GB graphics card, thanks to recent developments in llama.cpp that allow the transformer layers to run on the GPU.

item.title: What Wikipedia Did
item.description: - Jimmy Wales, the co-founder of Wikipedia, announced on Twitter that the Supreme Court of Turkey ruled in favor of the online encyclopedia's fight for freedom of expression.

item.title: The networkQuality tool on macOS
item.description: - The networkQuality tool is a built-in feature in macOS Monterey for measuring network performance and diagnosing network issues.

item.title: My dad built a cool thing but never boasted about it
item.description: - The author's father, who passed away recently, was a Bombay Sapper in the Indian Army and participated in the Bangladesh Liberation War as part of the 268 Engineer Regiment.

item.title: The World is Built on Probability (1984)
item.description: - The book 'The World Is Built On Probability' by Lev Tarasov argues that probability plays a fundamental role in modern life and nature.

item.title: 47% of all internet traffic came from bots in 2022?
item.description: - The 10th annual Bad Bot Report reveals that 47.4% of all internet traffic in 2022 came from bots, a 5.1% increase from the previous year.

item.title: OpenSnitch in Debian ready for prime time
item.description: - OpenSnitch, the interactive application firewall, is now available in Debian Bookworm, with the latest fixes and a GUI admin tool installed by default.

item.title: The Cathedral & the Bazaar (1999)
item.description: - "The Cathedral and the Bazaar" is an analysis of a successful open-source project called Fetchmail, which supports the argument that open-source development styles may outperform commercial development structures.

item.title: Are We Sixel Yet
item.description: - The article lists the support for the SIXEL graphics format across various terminal emulators, a format that allows displaying bitmap graphics in terminals.
